&#039;Bleeding Love&#039; is a pop/R&B ballad written by Ryan Tedder and Jesse McCartney and produced by Tedder for Leona Lewis&#039;s debut album, &#039;Spirit&#039;, on which it is the opening track. The song is the album&#039;s first single [Lewis&#039;s official second single following &#039;A Moment like This&#039;] released in the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland in October 2007. The single was released digitally in December 2007 in the United States, and worldwide between December 2007 and March 2008. &#039;Bleeding Love&#039; became the best selling single of 2007 in the UK, and has so far reached number one in the singles and airplay charts of over 15 countries.

There are two music videos for &#039;Bleeding Love&#039;. The first [International Version] was directed by Melina and was filmed in Los Angeles. It is set in an apartment block and features six storylines about couples in different stages of relationships: "The video is extremely emotional and shows everything from first love and unbridled passion to heartbreak, loss and anger". Lewis stated that it is "real colourful, very funky, has lots of extras and I get to really perform". Melina explained her meaning of the video in an interview on MTV&#039;s Making the Video, saying that the water in the video is a metaphor for the tenants&#039; love problems, as if the apartments are bleeding love. For the video, Lewis wore a Ãƒâ€šÃ‚Â£100,000 Dolce & Gabbana crystal-encrusted dress, which weighed forty pounds, and reportedly had an entourage of 150 people on set, including five stylists flown out from the UK. The same dress was later worn by Victoria Beckham in the video for the Spice Girls charity single &#039;Headlines [Friendship Never Ends]&#039;. The Spice Girls video is available at: http://www.torrentbox.com/torrent_details?id=148849  The video first aired on October 17th 2007, and was uploaded to popular video-sharing website YouTube the same day. After two weeks, the video had been viewed over three million times. As of March 1st 2008, it has been viewed over 29 million times. It is currently the 26th most viewed video of all time on YouTube.

Lewis filmed a second video [U.S. Version] in New York City for the US release of &#039;Bleeding Love&#039;. The treatment for the video was written by Ryan Tedder and it was directed by Jesse Terrero. The video premiered in the United States on January 29th 2008 on Yahoo Music. It was uploaded to YouTube on January 30th 2008. Its television debut was on February 4th 2008 on VH1. As of March 1st 2008, the US video for &#039;Bleeding Love&#039; has been viewed over 3 million times on YouTube.
